noun.description: A lizard-like amphibian with an elongated body and tail and short limbs, once thought able to endure fire.
A mythical lizard-like creature said to live in fire or to be able to withstand its effects.
A metal plate heated and placed over food to brown it.

origin: Middle English (in salamander (sense 2)): from Old French salamandre, via Latin from Greek salamandra. Sense 1 dates from the early 17th century.
